website_summaries.verdict: The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-RX100's compact, elegant design, generally excellent photo quality, bright, fast lens, and speedy performance make a great package if you don't mind spending a little more money.
pros: Speed, good looks, and pretty pictures number among the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-RX100's strengths
cons: The camera tends to clip bright highlights more than we typically see, and the slippery body lacks a grip
Plus, the lack of a manually triggered macro mode might put off some fans of close-up photography

customer_reviews.title: This older model is awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I know it is an older model, but the picture quality of this camera is awesome and met my expectations. I did not want to invest in a newer model since this camera offers all I need. I want to take great pictures in a compact camera when I travel. I do not care about 4k videos or touch screen features that newer models offer. This camera records awesome videos as well. Before I ordered it, I did a lot od research on Flickr and Youtube. I am very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: sbsmom

customer_reviews.title: The Holy Grail of Point-And-Shoots
customer_reviews.text: My mother likes photography, but she doesn't want to deal with the many buttons and complications that come with DSLRs. So, I purchase the RX100, and I am more than pleased. This takes great photos the FIRST not SECOND, THIRD, or FOURTH, but the FIRST time on auto, and I would buy it again if I had to. My mom loves it, I love it. It's a little pricey, but Sony is the best in the sensor game for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Harris

customer_reviews.title: I know everyone loves this camera, but...
customer_reviews.text: This camera has been glitchy from day one but we persisted. Now it has taken to draining fully charged batteries within hours, when the camera is not even turned on. This model seems to be on every "best point and shoot" list so perhaps we got a lemon, but I have to say that most of the pics we did get when it wasn't bugging out on us were only marginally better than those with an iPhone 6... Disappointed in pretty much every way with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PMunroe

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Point and Shoot Digital
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful point and shoot camera - used it on my trip to Mexico and it was incredible! Convenient, easy to use, and took great shots!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa K.

customer_reviews.title: A photographer's kind of camera
customer_reviews.text: This little gem replaces an old Nikon small camera whose lens operation failed. Couldn't find any small cameras in Nikon's lineup that I liked and that compared to what I had. This Sony camera is exactly what I wanted - it can be a simple point and shoot or it can give me photographic control when I want it for special pictures. Seems to be very well built.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2 1/2 years then stopped operating.
customer_reviews.text: Pictures were good, not spectacular. Flash was OK, better than most Canon cameras which consistently over-expose or erratically fill flash Does not have Macro function and does poorly at close-up photos. Very little JPEG compression so files are quite large. After 2 years stopped working for no apparent reason and lens will not go back in or fully out.
customer_reviews.author: F. Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this camera based on my brothers recomendation after my canon powershot Elph died. Im not camera savvy and always uses the presets on the camera. This particular camera in my humble novice opinion is not for beginners. You definitely should have more technical experience to get your moneys worth. With that said, I’m a novice, I use the presets and this camera takes really nice photos. The low light photographs are amazing and the color is rich. This camera has made me interested in the technical aspects enough where I am interested in learning more and seeing what more this camera will do
customer_reviews.author: Andrew stout

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camera for a mom with three busy kids
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! I wanted a camera that I could point and shoot and get better pics with than a phone camera. I set it on "intelligent auto", and "continuous shooting" drive mode, point, and shoot. Perfect for capturing those moments with fast and wiggly preschoolers and toddlers. I also got a book about the camera, which can walk me through the manu features of the camera as I learn and grow with it. Couldn't be happier with this camera choice! The only thing I would suggest is getting the model with wifi. You will want to share these sharp photos right away without having to to take the sd card out and downloading the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this has to be one of the best. color rendition is superb
customer_reviews.text: Over all my years dealing with point and shoot cameras, this has to be one of the best. color rendition is superb, even at close range. I opted for the first version instead of the newer, because, I didn't need many of the fancy features on the latest. I've e had many Nikon and canon's, but this one impresses me best because of the larger 1". Videos, with a light tripod are great. I am impressed. Purchase if you don't want to spend $1000.00 for their latest. Takes a bit to figure out their menu in comparison to Nikon and Canon. Pictures so far are vivid with detail and accurate colors.
customer_reviews.author: LSM

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera for taking videos
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera on the recommendation of a friend, and to be able to use when traveling in lieu of my heavy DSLR. The software is poorly executed, and the camera performs pretty much like the cheap point-and-shoot cameras popular ten years ago. I must say, however, that the camera does take an excellent HD video, with a zoom feature that really helps in some situations. So, I guess I have a nice compact HD video camera that I can carry in my pocket. As far as taking high quality stills, I'm lifting weights to start carrying around our clunky DSLR again.
customer_reviews.author: Value Appreciator

customer_reviews.title: Motor fails after 1 year, 3 weeks of owning this camera.  Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.text: This camera (motor) broke exactly one year and 3 weeks after my purchase of a NEW camera so it's no longer under warranty. Very unacceptable IMO. I loved the image quality but that is negated by such a short term life of the camera. I would not purchase this camera again. The problem was the lens wouldn't close. I took it to a camera repair shop and they said the motor failed and needed a new one- if I send it in, the cost to repair it is $350. Might as well buy a new one for almost the same price. But I definitely would not buy this same camera.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pocket shooter, turns neophyte into pro
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best no-brainer pocket shooter I've ever owned. I realize it has a myriad of scenic modes and manual control, but I usually just leave it in 'Intelligent' or 'Superior' mode and still get great results...as you can see in the attached pics from Big Sur. I may upgrade it to Mark2 with Wifi and NFC just to make life easier.
customer_reviews.author: GoBearsTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to use camera
customer_reviews.text: Great, easy to use camera! I took this on my trip to Patagonia and it took excellent photos of the mountains. The battery life is fine for my needs. My only complaint is that every time you switch modes an info screen pops up. If you are trying to take photos quickly, and switching between modes, this is really irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Malfufa

customer_reviews.title: RUN AWAY
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to return this. It is not a simply point and shoot camera. If auto is selected, true colors are not captured. The worst part is the only way to view the images is to download Sony's program. This program does not download or work on any of my laptops, so why have a camera? I can't keep all the photos on the camera. Battery lasts for about 2 hours if left on. A cheaper, non-Sony camera is better. And I hate to admit that because Sony was my favorite for electronics.
customer_reviews.author: RottenMags

customer_reviews.title: The small size and excellent video quality make it my go-to camera for hiking
customer_reviews.text: My quibbles with this camera are small. The image quality is outstanding. It rivals, and sometimes even surpasses, that of my full frame Alpha 900. The small size and excellent video quality make it my go-to camera for hiking. Even though it doesn't take filters, I can still hold an ND filter in front of the lens for long exposure shots.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am a Realtor shooting a large volume of photos both inside and outside homes. Previous Sony point and shoots have worked well for me especially in foreclosures with low ambient light. Almost 10% of the photos shot with this RX100 are out of focus. Sony (excellent product support) has professionally repaired this for me once and I am sending it in a second time this week. To make matters worse, I have also had consistent problems with an intermittent display screen. Imagine taking the picture, it is out of focus, and the display fails. Makes it hard to know when you need a second one right? If I could go back, I would avoid this model completely. Regards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Camera
customer_reviews.text: After owning it two months, and taking it on a week's vacation, I can say this camera has delivered on all my expectations. Pros: -picture quality -lots of controls -lots of picture effects including my favorite: black and white -compact size -long battery life -rechargeable batteries Cons: -wish it had more zoom -the colors on the viewscreen are not as rich or true as I would like Overall I am very satisfied and would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Mikila Velios

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Really like this camera! I wanted a camera without wifi. Makes sharp pics. Has a large light sensor, so you can get nice photos without flash. I never use flash, so I love that feature. I've experimented in low light situations and it performs well. Negatives: it's a little thick. Would be nice if it zoomed out more, but it would probably have to be thicker. Would be nice to have selfie capability. But again, it would have to be bulkier. I'm not wild about using the LCD screen for framing, but the camera does have the option to set the screen at outdoor/sunshine mode, so it gets brighter. All in all, really like the camera, alot.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: HDMI port is inacessible when mounted; ring stopped working immediately past warranty period
customer_reviews.text: Sony really dropped the ball with design on this camera - the HDMI port is immediately adjacent to the mount so it's not possible to use HDMI when this thing is on a tripod (literally, the cover for HDMI port access is a 90-degree "L" shape around the mount). Also, the ring stopped working immediately after the warranty expired. What a junk product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Aramaki

customer_reviews.title: Terrific little camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought the RX100 to replace an excellent but dying Canon S110 which I've used for years and many thousands of images. The Sony had a lot to live up to and has not disappointed. Great image quality, a very good menu system and solid build quality. The RX100 isn't the flashiest or newest of the RX100 line, but the price/value relationship is excellent and my experience with this camera would give me confidence to buy one of the newer, glitzier models. I do wish it had a 24mm equivalent wide end to the zoom, but overall, it's a great camera in a small package and it produces quality images.
customer_reviews.author: 21 Truck

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality camera deeply discounted.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful point and shoot camera, perfect travel camera with clear pictures. I purchased an after-market instructional booklet that was far more useful than the Sony user manual.
customer_reviews.author: Doodle

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful picture quality for a small camera
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Based on all of the reviews I read about this camera before I bought it, I expected excellent picture quality. And I got it. Low light capability is great. The camera is a little on the small side, but you get used to it, and it literally fits in a shirt pocket, even when it's in a small case. I love the camera and take it almost everywhere for a quality photo when I don't have my SLR.
customer_reviews.author: Pat T.

customer_reviews.title: But the Camera is still performing Beautifully.
customer_reviews.text: My previous Sony RX100 usually retains the date and time after it was Setup even though the Battery is removed, but this RX100 does not. Time and date has to be Re-Setup.if the Battery is removed. But the Camera is still performing Beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: PQB

customer_reviews.title: Stuck in the dark ages
customer_reviews.text: The camera takes fine pictures, in line with expectations based on specs and description. HOWEVER, there's no wireless image upload capability. For a camera in 2018, this is insane to me. PLUS, when I try to upload my images via laptop connection, it doesn't work AT ALL. It worked once and was incredibly time consuming, the next time it would only show the camera instructions in the toolbar, but photos nowhere to be found. What good is a camera if the images are stuck on the device, and can't be used?
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Rose

customer_reviews.title: amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: let me tell everyone i think this camera is amazing it produces better pictures then a smartphone its very good in low light what smartphones do when you zoom in is show more pixelation you wont get as much with the camera and you can do more amazing effects with the camera the camera takes beautiful pics im uploading a picture of this gatorade bottle its a very cool effect that cant be achived by any smartphone you need a camera for that this is a old model and its on sale buy it before it sells out.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Great camera that takes superb pictures
customer_reviews.text: Great camera that takes superb pictures. There's a load of functionality in this basic model, but its more than enough for my needs. It is so light and it fits easily in your hand. There is no WiFi or geo-tagging available on the RX100 first edition. The manual is quite extensive and Is only available via digital download. My only complaint is that Sony should have included the $14 hand grip as part of the camera. Since the camera is small and the lens is large, there is limited space to hold on to the camera. The grip should have been integrated into the body.
customer_reviews.author: Fredstench

customer_reviews.title: Nice point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to use on backpacking trips when I want the option to enlarge the picture. It is easy to use and gets great results even with the automatic settings. I haven't dived very deep into all the shooting options, but they seem pretty straight forward. I would definitely buy the screen protector as it seems like it would get scratched easily, but it made it through one 3-day backpacking trip so far without any issues. Oh and battery life is great!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Good PQ, may be i got a faulty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera back in November 19, 2012. The quality of picture is fantastic. My problem with this camera, its taking too much of time in between taking pictures (say busy writing) and missing key moments. I thought it may be SD card and tried different SD cards, I missed to contact Sony about this during initial years. I don't know contacting Sony will help anything fixing the issue, for this reason i'm hesitate to upgrade to the latest model of this camera. I bought it for $648, but due to this i'm using my Iphone X most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Solaris

customer_reviews.title: Still a great little camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great sensor, but keep in mind that this camera came out in 2012. Small fraction of the cost of the new model. Wish the zoom range and ISO range were better. RAW, bounce flash, Zeiss lens, array of manual settings, impressive panoramic,.. No wi-fi, video not at 4K, loses some funstionality when shooting RAW, no eletronic viewfinder, and not the latest technology ( improved focus, more frames per second, slow motion video). Suggest getting the rubber grip from Sony - makes it much easier to hold. For the money it is still a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Zenowy Bojczuk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Really incredible small format camera that can be taken anywhere. When I can't lug my DSLR around with me in the mountains or climbing, the RX100 is always with me. The 1" sensor makes a huge difference and the lens is of very high quality. Rivals some shots taken with my Nikon D3300. Extremely happy with it. Go ahead and buy the Sony grip and screen protector as well. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: ECA

customer_reviews.title: Great low light image capability
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding low light quality. Quite remarkable actually for this tiny camera. My biggest pet peeve is where the movie button is located, right next to where your thumb goes and I’m constantly hitting it by mistake. Second issue is with the macro. Very difficult to get a steady shot close up, it’s like Steady Shot is off completely even though I know it’s not. Plus not having wi-fi is a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: SherryS

customer_reviews.title: Pair this with Sony-only Capture One vers.11 for spectacular images (shoot RAW!!!)
customer_reviews.text: Very capable camera, and great deal on the original since it's now up to version 6! Pair this version 1 with Sony's Capture One version 11 software ($75) for stunning results!!!!
customer_reviews.author: blairtech

customer_reviews.title: Small but great
customer_reviews.text: Surprised by how small it is. Great images. Not really a point and shoot. Have worked around complexities by anticipating shots and setting camera accordingly. Grid setting for screen is a huge help. Adjustable flash really helps. Down load manual a must. Also, second market manuals provide additional help.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Bob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little camera!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little camera! Takes great pictures and videos. I think it's terrific that Sony still offers this older/original model without WiFi or flip screen. Not only to save money, because if you just don't want that in the camera, this is a terrific option. When they get the overheating issues for 4k video sorted out in the newest iterations...then that will be worth considering.
customer_reviews.author: NYC

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This little bitty is an absolute pleasure to use. Pictures are excellent quality! Color incredibly beautiful. It brackets and de-hazes your photos which is surprising. Every photo, in any light, has come out exceptionally sharp and the colors very nice. If you just want to point and shoot....this is about as good as it gets! ~ Thanks ;o)
customer_reviews.author: corey

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love love this camera. Pictures are super crisp with at or near DSLR quality. So many settings and options that I dont know what to do which one to settle on. It has slowed down a bit after a lot of usage so it may be a battery thing. I love the picture setting effects that you shoot. Video capture quality is top notch. DSRL-ish camera in a compact body. Can't ask for a better camera. Negatives - Pricey - Has slowed a bit after much usage, not a biggie but nitpicking. - Can't change picture effects after taking a pitcure, It would be nice if I could have done so but not a biggie and just nicpicking.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: soo perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted a small camera that cool take great pictures at night as well and also small and this one is soo perfect
customer_reviews.author: Viviana

customer_reviews.title: Its compact size is great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my daily point and shoot camera. Its compact size is great for traveling, and it also captures the details very well. I dropped it for a couple of times and it is making a little weird noises now when I focus..but it still works perfectly other than that. So I guess just don't drop it...like any other electronic devices..unless it's a Nokia. Overall, I love it. Great pictures for its small size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful images and great stabilization
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I had with this camera was the lack of an viewfinder. The display while beautiful is useless when outside with bright light and I found myself constantly guessing at framing of my subject. The large number of pixels is helpful when you have to compensate for the lack of a long zoom as you can crop away a lot of the image and still have a sizeable image remaining.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Professional Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: You cannot get a better point and shoot camera. this camera handles high iso's like no other point and shoot. Low light pictures look good blown up or printed. It has good range. It also has numerous creative settings that can keep you busy for a long while. It also has an amazing video stabilization that will shock you. I carry this camera around when I am not carrying my $7000 professional DSLR around. My 1st one got stolen out of my truck and I bought a 2nd one soon after. I couldn't function the same without it.
customer_reviews.author: Hondawg

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find settings
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a long time before choosing a camera to replace my Canon. It takes fantastic high resolution pictures at 20 megs. This is great news for the quality of photos, but bad news for my memory card. It's a somewhat compact camera but doesn't slips so easily into a front pocket. My only real issue with this camera is that there are so many options on the dial and when you factor in the function and menu buttons it's nearly impossible to find some settings like low light and fast action.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Service

customer_reviews.title: Best PnS on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this point and shoot for the wife on her BDay. She is a pic fanatic, and LOVES this camera. Best sensor on a PnS pocket(ish) sized cam on the market. We considered an SLR, but the ease of use on this camera made it the winner. Auto features are very nice: Blew her mind taking the first few pictures of our new daughter w/ this cam--display said BABY once it focused!
customer_reviews.author: the North

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a compact camera that offers manual control and couldn't be happier. Far superior to any other digital camera I've owned. Pictures are gorgeous and it's amazing how well is handles really bad lighting conditions (shooting into the sun, for example). So many options are available, you'll enjoy spending months getting to know everything this camera can do.
customer_reviews.author: PhillipS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent image quality, perfect compact size!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture quality (compared to my compact Canon point and shoot). Exactly what I was hoping to achieve for substantial picture quality improvement and very compact size. In comparison to the Canon Elph with 1/2.3" CMOS sensor, the images have great contrast and depth (nice darks and highlights) and the colors are rich and correct (the old camera looks muted in all comparisons). Video mode is amazingly smooth, perhaps like a real video camera and again, with great detail and image quality.
customer_reviews.author: G K

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the perfect compromise between a small point and click and a large, expensive camera. The quality of photos is just stunning. I take it on vacations because it's portable, but I don't feel like it draws so much attention to me that I'm going to get robbed.
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: I bought this because it's small and can compete with my pro SLR's and LOVED IT - but had to return it as it ...
customer_reviews.text: Killer camera. I'm a studio owner - (retired) after 35 highly successful years. I bought this because it's small and can compete with my pro SLR's and LOVED IT - but had to return it as it was the PAL not NTSC version that was shipped. (Abe's) they did take it back for full refund. I will order again after the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small camera
customer_reviews.text: I have an SLR camera but is so big and cumbersome. This camera is small enough to put in your pocket or on a belt pouch or purse. I really like the double picture feature for people pictures. However, make sure you use the wrist loop because the camera is so small that you can easily drop it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Zuhlke

customer_reviews.title: The Sony is Well Worth the Trade Up
customer_reviews.text: The Sony DSC-RX100 has been a fun camera to explore with and I am merely scratching the surface in terms of learning and mastering all of its capabilities. The best thing about the camera is that you don't have to be a Rhodes Scholar to take good photos with the coverage as long as you take the time to compose your shot. I traded my Canon PowerShot SX280 HS for the Sony and I must admit I don't miss the extra zoom.
customer_reviews.author: d crenshaw

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous camera!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous camera! Small. Lightweight. Delivers amazing color quality. I use it strictly on “automatic” mode — literally, point-and-shoot. Taking pictures has become fun and easy, again. Got tired of lugging around clunky cameras! I hang this around my neck, beneath my shirt, and whip it out and “click.” Head and shudders above other point-and-shoot cameras in its class.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Luther Martin, PhD

customer_reviews.title: Liked this camera better than the Lumix
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after the similarly sized Lumix I had broke down. The Lumix had a better zoom but on all other counts -size, weight, picture quality, ease of use — this camera was much better
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Drake

customer_reviews.title: The clarity of photos is amazing. Being from the "slide rule" generation
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to replace a balky and unreliable digital camera prior to a trip to Israel in late 2015. The clarity of photos is amazing. Being from the "slide rule" generation, I found some of the menus and functions somewhat baffling or daunting. But somehow came back with many, many wonderful photos. If you go on such a trip, get a camera and don't count on just your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Rick in Columbia, SC

customer_reviews.title: This compact point and shoot takes amazing pictures and has a fast shutter speed
customer_reviews.text: Only owned it for a month, but all the reviews hit the nail on the button. This compact point and shoot takes amazing pictures and has a fast shutter speed. Am a little worried that the flash will one day break since it is a moveable object (it springs open, then you have to manually press it down to close), but otherwise the camera body seems very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: A pocket camera that is a cut above
customer_reviews.text: The larger light sensor in this camera generates far-higher-quality images than most pocket cameras. The ability to operate the camera manually makes it excellent for night photography using long exposures employing different apertures and ISO settings.
customer_reviews.author: Careful buyer

customer_reviews.title: Small, simple, powerful.
customer_reviews.text: After using my old P&S since 2007 it was time for an upgrade. I do a lot of travel and outdoor sports and needed something small and powerful. I had narrowed it down to this or the Canon S120. I did not want a touch or articulating screen, wifi, gps, efv, or anything like that. That was the deciding factor for the RX-100, a simple, small, powerful camera.
customer_reviews.author: Farva

customer_reviews.title: My new carry camera...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the RX100 for a few days, but I have already decided to sell my often used S95 and barely used LX-5 on ebay. The RX100 is NOT just marginally better than both, it is a quantum leap in image quality. My wishes for the next iteration: 24mm at the wide end and a paper manual... otherwise great job by Sony on this one!! Update: While the image quality of this camera was indeed excellent, I found that I did not like the day-to-day ergonomics of this camera. I have since sold it.
customer_reviews.author: Otter

customer_reviews.title: Compact camera with high aperture that saves in RAW. Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I usually take this camera to take some pictures at concerts and it's awesome. With F1.8 aperture and being able to save RAW it's pretty much all you can ask (okay, I could ask for the same aperture when you zoom in, but that would be too much to ask).
customer_reviews.author: Renato

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to handle..video button convenient
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures small and compact.. Even with low level light.. My pictures came out great still trying to figure all settings.. Video was great.. Low level light no flash on the 4th july
customer_reviews.author: dresden67

customer_reviews.title: Best pocket camera in the market. Period.
customer_reviews.text: I decide to downgrade from a DSLR to this camera because I didn't want to carry it around...best decision of my life. This camera takes amazing pictures and great videos. Worth every penny specially now that it went down in price. It it ever breaks I will get it again, maybe the 100 II or III. The reviews are spot on. If you are a beginner, you'll be blown away. If you are a pro you will be blown away too. It is pocket size but a bit too big for your jeans, still fits but looks a bit bulky. That's something that I was willing to compromise. Fits perfectly in your jacket or jeans back pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Viejo

customer_reviews.title: it worked great. I wanted a small camera that would take ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to take on vacation, it worked great. I wanted a small camera that would take great photos and this did the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautiful camera. It takes awesome pictures
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful camera. It takes awesome pictures. It was delivered as advertised in the original box with a Sony case, and a battery. It also came with the original Manuel. The video it takes is incredible as well. I received this camera in very speedy fashion. ..would definitely buy from this seller again. Thank you so much...
customer_reviews.author: firefox09

customer_reviews.title: ... had this about 6 months now and I really love it. This high quality piece of machinery fits ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this about 6 months now and I really love it. This high quality piece of machinery fits in you pocket, takes excellent photos and gives you a ton of options for how you want to capture that perfect shot. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I needed this as a backup and something with great picture quality to keep in my van at all times. Image quality is on par with my larger Sony RX-10! And although I prefer a good viewfinder, I've now lgotten used to the LCD back screen, and find it works good enough for most shots. If you're looking for a very small, truly pocket camera with fantastic image quality – then look no further!
customer_reviews.author: J. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, good photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought it cheap on amazon warehouse. Capable of taking excellent photographs.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for a trip to S/E Asia, and it did not let me down. For its size, it delivers amazing pictures and the videos are excellent. Not the cheapest pocket camera by any stretch, but it does in fact fit in your pocket. The large CCD works well in relatively low light, and it is fitted to an excellent lens. The only downside is the menu and buttons, which I found required some time to figure out. The instructions are useless. Great hardware, but not the best documentation. I strongly recommend this camera for travelers, as it fits in a pocket or purse, and delivers near SLR images.
customer_reviews.author: John Anton Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera, some of the photos you couldn't tell ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera, some of the photos you couldn't tell apart from my DSLR. Best substitute for my canon when traveling

customer_reviews.author: Karzats

customer_reviews.title: The best compact camera in the market
customer_reviews.text: It's not hard for me to say this is the best compact camera in the market. I was looking for the best possible camera that fits in my pocket and after reading other reviews I finally bought the Sony RX100 and it is amazing. The quality of the pictures is just incredible and all the features in the camera let you play with your pictures like a pro. I really recommend this camera for everyone looking for the best possible compact camera out there. It is a bit expensive but you won't even remember about the price after you start seeing the pictures you took.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Cerda Barra

customer_reviews.title: Nice but needed more.
customer_reviews.text: It took really good photos, but after evaluating several drawbacks of this camera, it was a better decision to return it. I can honestly say this does take some amazing photos though for the short time that I had mine.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Codere

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I have a Nikon D300 and D7000. I needed a smaller point and shoot to take with me on a trip where I was concerned about theft of the larger camera. I am generally frustrated by point and shoots because of the shutter delay. This camera had virtually no shutter delay. It was quite responsive. It is flexible and the photos are quite sharp for what it is. Very versatile and solid. My only complaint is the battery seemed to run down quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Nod Blinkin

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little camera. Pro-like quality pics with convenience of pocket portability. Lots of fine tuning options. Sub-par user manual. Use of wrist strap or lanyard a necessity due to small size, lack of grips. I also use a 58-mm Schneider-Kreuznach filter cap to protect lens assembly while in the pocket, travel bag. No need to lug around a DSLR for most shooting, travel, etc with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera
customer_reviews.text: The rx100 takes excellent photos and videos, particularly in low light. The only weakness, in my opinion, is the built in video stabilization is not very effective when taking videos while walking.
customer_reviews.author: JCK

customer_reviews.title: I was beyond impressed with this camera. It has ...
customer_reviews.text: I was beyond impressed with this camera. It has some of the nicest low light capturing abilities I have seen in any point and shoot to date. Purchased for my wife, slowly became my camera for night pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Clark

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Camera
customer_reviews.text: Even with a Nikon D700 and a Sony A7 in my bag, the RX100 is my go-to camera for days when I don't want to be noticed. A perfect size, durable (handled a drop with aplomb), and ready to shoot in seconds, this camera is my trusted companion.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy E. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: best low light camera I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: best low light camera I've ever owned. So much better than lugging around a larger bodied device, and a similar picture quality. I read that this is what photographers use for their own vacations, and when our friend who IS a photographer came to my son's birthday party, I asked her to take my camera and grab some shots for me. She said, "Oh, hey! I have this camera! It's great, right?" And so yeah, it's fabulous for average parents like me and professional photographers alike.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: One of the best cameras available. With the high MP you can crop way down which is handy for my nature shots. I only wish it had an electronic view finder option for taking outdoor shots in bright sunlight.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic buy!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera! I've owned a few point and shoot cameras over the years, but this one tops them all. I did plenty of research before buying and everything pointed toward this model. It's been solid, Bought with the premium leather case - an excellent and well-fitting add on to keep it protected but still easy to sling over your shoulder. I've taken amazing photos of my kids - frame worthy shots. The intelligent photo option works amazingly well, and the large sensor size is great at capturing stellar photos in low light. Highly recommended to anyone looking for a point and shoot camera in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.author: Greg T.

It focus very fast and take good photos both outdoors (easy) and indoors (hard). I wish it had a better manual that came with it. The ? funciton is pretty useless. Now I just need lightroom to recognize the RX100 raw files. Overall great little P&S camera.

It's easy to use and the flash works great. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this camera even though there are a few newer models above this one.

customer_reviews.title: great point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I shoot with a "giant" DSLR that I carry to most occasions where I need super high quality pictures, but I also carry the point and shoot when the bulk of the big camera is impractical. I have owned many of the Canon G series, and more recently S95/S100s and I think this camera is higher quality. There are a few cons: the flash is fragile/awkward and casts a bluish tint. Menus are confusing, canon menus are simpler/easier to use. Overall still great and worth the upgrade.

customer_reviews.text: Took this on a trip to Italy and fell in love. Fits nicely in a pocket, and it's easy to whip out and shoot. Never needed to use the flash. Terrific for taking pictures in dark churches. Also good at backlit scenes and sunsets. The three-in-one picture ability (interleaving three exposures) saved a bunch of shots. I have scarcely used the fancier features yet. My only complaint: the documentation/instructions are thin. A friend who bought this camera before me found some guy who'd created a pdf of the online instruction manual that I was able to put on a tablet and study one rainy afternoon....

customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera. It takes great pictures.Yes it is heavy and small. If you have large hands this may not be the camera for you.

customer_reviews.title: RAW work around
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic camera. Believe the great reviews. And believe reviewers who report that Sony's RAW software (Image Data Converter - IDC) is weak, at best. My guess is Adobe will release a good converter soon. Meanwhile I found an easy workaround that gives me most of the capabilities of an excellent RAW converter. I use Sony's IDC to send 16- or 8-bit TIF files to Photoshop. (IDC didn't find my copy of PS-5 until I told it where to look.) That way I can keep all 20+ megapixels and have access to Photoshop's huge palette of magic tools when adjusting the TIFs.

product_meta.description:

For more in depth look, check out the RX-100 brochure. Input Output Terminals: Hi-Speed USB (USB 2.0), Micro HDMI, Micro USB. Shutter Speed: iAuto (4-1/2000), Program Auto (1-1/2000), Manual (30-1/2000), Shutter Priority (30-1/2000), Aperture Priority (8-1/2000)

FROM THE MANUFACTURER







Cyber-shot Digital Camera
DSC-RX100 

Exquisite image quality and creative freedom in a truly compact package. For razor-sharp images and pro-quality defocused backgrounds, the RX100 features a large, 1" sensor and an ultra-bright Carl Zeiss f/1.8 lens. It also features a handy control ring for easy access to aperture settings and more for total creative freedom. 


TECHNOLOGY


1" EXMOR CMOS SENSOR, 20.2 MP
Compared to the average point and shoot 1/2.3" sensor size, the RX100 boasts a large, specially developed 1" Exmor CMOS sensor to capture more light and reproduce every stunning detail with greater fidelity. Original dual noise reduction & column A/D conversion further decrease noise to ensure smooth, clear reproduction - even in low-light.

BRIGHT F1.8 CARL ZEISS VARIO-SONNAR T* LENS
Newly developed large-diameter F1.8 Carl Zeiss Vario-Sonnar T* lens delivers refined background defocusing - bokeh. A premium multi-layered T* coating also dramatically reduces ghost and flare caused by light reflection.

WIDE RANGE ISO SENSITIVITY
Shoot in nearly any light with natural results thanks to sensitivity that ranges from ISO 125 to 6400. Auto ISO mode automatically determines the most appropriate setting, or manually expand sensitivity for greater control. The bright lens, extra large sensor and precision image processing work together to ensure remarkably low noise.




COMPLETE CREATIVE CONTROL
Get SLR-like handling with a full range of controls for video and still shooting-from Program, Aperture Priority, Shutter Priority and Manual (P/A/S/M) modes for more advanced photographers, to an incredibly effective iAuto mode perfect for beginners. On-screen prompts help you refine your skills and exercise greater creative control.

RAW IMAGE CAPTURE
Save pictures as compact JPEG files, ultra high-quality RAW files, or both at once. When shooting in RAW format, images are saved prior to de-mosaicing or applying white balance, sharpness and color enhancement for maximum latitude when enhancing images on your PC.

GORGEOUS FULL HD VIDEO
Create amazingly clear, extra-smooth movies with Full HD 1080/60p video capture in the AVCHDâ„¢ Ver. 2.0 (progressive) format at a high frame rate of 60 fps. You can even record fast-moving subjects and dark settings with astonishing clarity thanks to the large image sensor and high-performance lens.




ADDITIONAL FEATURES

MASSIVE 1" EXMOR CMOS SENSOR, 20.2 MP
The massive Exmor CMOS sensor with 20.2 MP captures ultra-high definition images that take full advantage of the cameraâ€™s sharp Carl ZeissÂ® Vario-Tessar T* lens. The sensor enables advanced column A/D processing that reduces noise levels, resulting in astonishing low light images with incredible smooth and clear details.

BRIGHT F1.8 CARL ZEISS VARIO-SONNAR T* LENS WITH 3.6X ZOOM
Newly developed large-diameter F1.8 Carl Zeiss Vario-Sonnar T* lens delivers refined background defocusing - bokeh. A premium multi-layered T* coating also dramatically reduces ghost and flare caused by light reflection.

P/A/S/M MODES FOR VIDEO AND STILLS
Enjoy a full range of controls for video and still shooting from the beginner's iAUTO mode to P/A/S/M: Program, Aperture Priority, Shutter Priority and Manual. On-screen prompts help you refine your skills, build your confidence and exercise greater creative control.

CAPTURE JPEG FILES, RAW FILES, OR BOTH
The DSC-RX100 saves pictures as compact JPEG files and/or ultra-high quality RAW files. RAW files save images prior to de-mosaicing, white balance, sharpness and color enhancement. This retains maximum latitude for enhancing the image on your PC.

FULL HD 1080/60P
Record crystal clear movies at the highest resolution available with capabilities for 60p in 1080. This provides stunning, fast motion video with less distortion for playback on your HD TV.2 With dual record of stills and movies, you can shoot both at the same time.

LOW-LIGHT ISO 6400 SENSITIVITY
ncredibly clear low-light pictures without sacrificing detail, made possible by the low-noise ExmorÂ® CMOS image sensor and refined BIONZÂ® image processor.

HIGH SPEED AUTO FOCUS
To improve focusing speed and sensitivity, the ExmorÂ® CMOS sensor uses its rapid throughput to deliver high-quality image signals to the cameraâ€™s BIONZÂ® processor, which provides intelligent response data to a new high speed actuator motor in the lens. The result is fast, DSLR-like focusing speeds even in low light.

CAPTURE THE DECISIVE MOMENT WITH UP TO 10FPS
Capture full 20.2 megapixel resolution images at up to 10 frames per second, helping to ensure that the decisive moment is captured such as the soccer ball flying into the goal. In addition, a mechanical shutter helps reduce distortion when continuously shooting moving subjects.

3" XTRA FINE LCD DISPLAY
The 3" (1,229k dots) Xtra Fine LCD Display makes it easy to scroll through menus and preview life. WhiteMagic increases visibility in bright daylight. The large display delivers brilliant-quality still images and movies while enabling easy focusing operation.

CUSTOMIZABLE FUNCTION BUTTON
Assign up to seven different functions to the function button, to allow quick access to your most frequently used features.

OPTICAL STEADYSHOT WITH ACTIVE MODE
Optical SteadyShot™ with Active Mode for blur-free movies even while walking. Camera-shake compensation using Optical SteadyShot/Active Mode has been improved with the addition of new electronic image stabilization. Now it’s easier than ever to obtain sharp, blur-free movies even when zooming in unsteady situations, such as shooting with one hand while walking.

MEMORY RECALL
MR (memory recall) mode can memorize up to three groups of the user's preferred settings. Settings include zoom magnification, white balance, exposure compensation, date, and grid lines. This enables quick switching of settings at the right moment.

SOPHISTICATED METAL BODY
The sophisticated aluminum body is lightweight, slim, and strong.

AUTO PORTRAIT FRAMING
Simply photograph a person and Auto Portrait Framing will save an additional, optimally framed image in portrait or landscape orientation. Combining Face Detection and By Pixel Super Resolution technologies with rule of thirds, Auto Portrait Framing provides beautifully composed and appealingly balanced full resolution portraits.

AUTO HDR MODE
Captures more scene dynamic range than a single exposure can handle—and more range than photo film. Combines the best highlight detail from one shot, the best mid-tones from a second and the best shadow detail from a third for one incredible shot (up to 6 EV stops). Captures in a split second. (Recommended for still subjects.)

FACE DETECTION/ REGISTRATION TECHNOLOGY
The camera can automatically detect and register up to eight individual faces and adjust focus, exposure, white balance and flash to help deliver crisp, properly lit images of family and friends. Can prioritize children or adults.

MULTI-ASPECT RATIO RECORDING FOR STILL IMAGES
Capture still images in any of four aspect ratios — 1:1, 2:3, 4:3, or 16:9 (vertical to horizontal). This provided the freedom to choose a ratio that matches the scene or the specific shooting purpose.

3.6X OPTICAL/7.2X CLEAR IMAGE DIGITAL ZOOM
Most digital zooms use electronic cropping to get closer to the subject, resulting in unsharp images. With Clear Image Zoom the powerful processor compares patterns found in adjacent pixels and creates new pixels to match selected patterns, resulting in more realistic, higher-quality images. Clear Image Zoom digitally doubles optical zoom for closer photos.

BUILT IN POP UP FLASH
Enjoy the convenience of flash photography everywhere you go.

FOUR FOCUSING MODES
This camera has two Autofocus modes: Single-shot AF (AF-S) or Continuous AF (AF-C), which tracks moving objects. It also has Manual Focus for manual focusing freedom, and Direct Manual Focus (DMF), that first uses autofocusing to focus on the subject, and then allows fast and easy switching to manual focusing for even more precise adjustment.

DIGITAL LEVEL GAUGE
Digital level gauge to allow easier leveling of the camera.

MF ASSIST AND PEAKING
Manual focus becomes much easier because peaking highlights the edges that are in focus in your choice of three colors (white, red, or yellow). This is especially helpful during macro or portrait photography where your focus setting can make or break your shot.

MULTI-FRAME NOISE REDUCTION
In this mode, the camera automatically shoots multiple images and layers them to produce a single noise-free image. This method provides noise reduction equivalent to a 2-stop lower shutter speed while maintaining the same aperture setting. Since the Multi Frame NR mode can be used in combination with P/A/S/M modes, it expands the user’s shooting flexibility.

PHOTO CREATIVITY
The Photo Creativity interface enables you to easily enjoy the creative expression of SLR-quality digital imaging without complex jargon. Changes can be combined/ removed and viewed in real time on the LCD making it a breeze to make adjustments. Choose from several different Photo Creativity functions using the convenient control wheel and center button including; Picture Effect, Background Defocus, Color, Brightness, and Vividness.

PICTURE EFFECT MODE
Realize your creative potential with Picture Effect, a fun and simple way to convert ordinary landscapes and portraits come to life by heightening mood and emphasizing certain attributes. Effects are Soft Focus, Posterization, Retro Photo, High Contrast Monochrome, Rich-tone Monochrome, Miniature, Soft High-key, Toy Camera, Pop Color, Partial Color, Watercolor Painting, HDR Painting, and Illustration.

CREATIVE STYLE SETTINGS
Control how the camera processes your images with six finishing styles: Standard, Vivid, B&W, Sunset, Portrait and Landscape. You can even fine-tune contrast, saturation, and sharpness to your personal taste.

SWEEP PANORAMA™ MODE
Capture expansive landscapes automatically. Press the shutter, sweep vertically or horizontally. The camera does the rest, continuously shooting images and stitching them together.

SUPERIOR AUTO MODE
Get cleaner, more dynamic pictures and fewer missed shots. The camera automatically recognizes the correct scene mode, then quickly shoots and combines up to six shots to produce images with greater clarity, optimum dynamic range using Backlight Correction HDR technology and lower image noise using 6 shots layering technology. Superior Auto intelligently detects 33 scenes for still images and movies, making it easy to get the best shot.

INTELLIGENT SCENE RECOGNITION MODE
Intelligent Scene Recognition (iSCN) Mode automatically detects 33 different types of scenes for photos and 44 scenes for movies, and then selects the appropriate camera settings. In Auto Mode, the camera takes a single shot using the optimal settings. In Advanced Mode, the camera takes a photo with the optimal settings and, if in difficult lighting (low light or back light) immediately takes a second photo with another optimized setting so you can choose which to keep.
